Executive Summary for the Erie County Water Authority Sturgeon Point and Van de Water-Water Treatment Plants.   



Accident Release Prevention Policy: The Authority will take every reasonable action to prevent all accidental releases. This is accomplished by using the most current design, training, and inspecting processes available. The Authority's prevented maintenance program includes:



1)      Analysis of the scrubber media tested twice per year, verification the scrubber neutralization    capacity for chlorine.

2)    The Halogen eclipse automatic shutoff valves are annually factory tested. 

3)    Gas detectors are tested weekly. 

4)    Chlorine zinc plated flexible connectors replaced yearly.



Operating and maintenance procedures are reviewed annually and are officially approved as the accepted operating procedures. 

Personnel are annually trained on operation and maintenance procedures. 

The Stationary Source for Chlorine (CAS No. 7782-50-5) remains the same since the original RMP 1999



Sturgeon Point Worst -Case Scenario

The Worst-case Scenario was completed for 2017 (using the RMP*Comp and Marplot) with a radius of 1.3  miles for a rural area. The Alternative Release Scenario was completed for 2017 (using the RMP*Comp and Marplot) with radius of .4 miles for a rural area.  



Sturgeon Point

The Fire Chief and volunteers of the Highland Hose Volunteer Fire Company, Evans NY  annually reviews and  inspects the Sturgeon Point treatment plant last visit October 2016



Sturgeon Point Maintenance Updates 2015-2016

1) Chlorine detector located in the cylinder supply area was relocated closer in the cylinders

2) Crane stops on the chlorine crane were re-position to avoid crane from contacting chlorine piping.

3) Erie County Emergency Services requested signs posting for Empty and Full cylinders in chlorine supply.

4) Standardize on opening cylinder valves using a 6" twisted wrench approved by chlorine institute.

5) A detail procedure on replacing chlorin

e piping by purging with Nitrogen.

Sturgeon Point Equipment

In 2016 the ECWA installed a central Fire/Chlorine alarm system in its main facility. Progress in  2017 is to complete installation of the Fire /Chlorine alarm in remaining buildings. The Fire /Chlorine Alarm system will alert plant personnel of a release and to evacuate the area. 





Van de Water Maintenance 

1)    Analysis of the scrubber media tested twice per year, verification the scrubber neutralization capacity for chlorine.

2)    The Halogen eclipse automatic shutoff valves are annually factory tested. 

3)    Gas detectors are tested weekly. 

4)    Chlorine zinc plated flexible connectors replaced yearly.



Van de Water Worst Case Scenario

The Worst-case Scenario was completed for 2017 (using the RMP*Comp) with a radius of 1.5 miles for a urban area. The Alternative Release Scenario was completed for 2017 (using the RMP*Comp) with a radius of 0.5 miles for on an urban area.  

Population was based on using the Marplot program. 



Van de Water 

The Fire Chief and Volunteers of the Brighton Fire Company has reviewed and inspected the Van de Water Treatment Plant. The Erie County Emergency Services has reviewed and inspected this facility.



Van de Water Equipment

In 2014 -15 the ECWA installed a central Fire/Chlorine alarm system in various area of the plant. The Fire /Chlorine Alarm system will alert plant personnel of a release and to evacuate the area



Training

The Authority continues to provide additional Hazwoper training as Hazmat Site Coordinators to assist the  Emergency Service Hazmat team in the event of major chlorine release . 



Employee Participation Annual Training

Plant personnel recommend suggestion. During the 2016 training review personnel suggested changing Chlorine procedures steps for connecting chlorine cylinders..
